alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cameron County through 230 PM CDT... At 201 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over El Jardin Elementary School, or near Port Of Brownsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Of Brownsville, Southmost, Brownsville, Lopez High School, Villa Pancho, Southmost Elementary School, Veterans International Bridge, Brownsville Public Library Southmost Branch, North Brownsville Little League and Perkins Middle School. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
